books.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs

chapters.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:1
verses.text: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs: When Praesens, for the second time, and Claudianus were the consuls, on the seventeenth day of July, at Carthage, there were set in the judgment-hall Speratus, Nartzalus, Cittinus, Donata, Secunda and Vestia.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:2
verses.text: Saturninus the proconsul said:  Ye can win the indulgence of our lord the Emperor, if ye return to a sound mind.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:3
verses.text: Speratus said:  We have never done ill, we have not lent ourselves to wrong, we have never spoken ill, but when ill-treated we have given thanks; because we pay heed to our Emperor.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:4
verses.text: Saturninus the proconsul said:  We too are religious, and our religion is simple, and we swear by the genius of our lord the Emperor, and pray for his welfare, as ye also ought to do.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:5
verses.text: Speratus said:  If thou wilt peaceably lend me thine ears, I can tell thee the mystery of simplicity.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:6
verses.text: Saturninus said:  I will not lend mine ears to thee, when thou beginnest to speak evil things of our sacred rites; but rather swear thou by the genius of our lord the Emperor.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:7
verses.text: Speratus said:  The empire of this world I know not; but rather I serve that God, whom no man hath seen, nor with these eyes can see.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:8
verses.text: I have committed no theft; but if I have bought anything I pay the tax; because I know my Lord, the King of kings and Emperor of all nations.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:9
verses.text: Saturninus the proconsul said to the rest:  Cease to be of this persuasion.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:10
verses.text: Speratus said:  It is an ill persuasion to do murder, to speak false witness.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:11
verses.text: Saturninus the proconsul said:  Be not partakers of this folly.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:12
verses.text: Cittinus said:  We have none other to fear, save only our Lord God, who is in heaven.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:13
verses.text: Donata said:  Honour to Caesar as Caesar:  but fear to God.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:14
verses.text: Vestia said:  I am a Christian.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:15
verses.text: Secunda said:  What I am, that I wish to be.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:16
verses.text: Saturninus the proconsul said to Speratus:  Dost thou persist in being a Christian?  Speratus said:  I am a Christian.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:17
verses.text: And with him they all agreed.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:18
verses.text: Saturninus the proconsul said:  Will ye have a space to consider?  Speratus said:  In a matter so straightforward there is no considering.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:19
verses.text: Saturninus the proconsul said:  What are the things in your chest?  Speratus said:  Books and epistles of Paul, a just man.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:20
verses.text: Saturninus the proconsul said:  Have a delay of thirty days and bethink yourselves.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:21
verses.text: Speratus said a second time:  I am a Christian.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:22
verses.text: And with him they all agreed.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:23
verses.text: Saturninus the proconsul read out the decree from the tablet:  Speratus, Nartzalus, Cittinus, Donata, Vestia, Secunda and the rest having confessed that they live according to the Christian rite, since after opportunity offered them of returning to the custom of the Romans they have obstinately persisted, it is determined that they be put to the sword.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:24
verses.text: Speratus said:  We give thanks to God.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:25
verses.text: Nartzalus said:  To-day we are martyrs in heaven; thanks be to God.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:26
verses.text: Saturninus the proconsul ordered it to be declared by the herald:  Speratus, Nartzalus, Cittinus, Veturius, Felix, Aquilinus, Laetantius, Januaria, Generosa, Vestia, Donata and Secunda, I have ordered to be executed.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:27
verses.text: They all said:  Thanks be to God.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:28
verses.text: And so they all together were crowned with martyrdom; and they reign with the Father and the Son and the Holy Ghost, for ever and ever.

verses.name: The Passion of the Scillitan Martyrs 1:29
verses.text: Amen.
